Use an antimicrobial mouthwash to kill harmful bacteria that may contribute to tooth decay and gum disease.
Floss at least once a day to remove plaque and food debris from between your teeth where a toothbrush cannot reach.

Eat a balanced diet with foods rich in vitamins and minerals, including fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins. Limit sugary and acidic foods and drinks to minimize the risk of developing cavities and tooth decay.
Brush your tongue to remove bacteria and freshen your breath.
Visit a dental care professional periodically for exams and cleanings, as they can identify early signs of potential dental problems and offer professional advice on maintaining good oral health.
